results.title: Errol Flynn
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Errol Flynn’s natural charm and good looks saw him become a screen legend as Hollywood’s greatest swashbuckling lover and matinee idol. This film takes an irreverent look at the nineteen year old Flynn’s escapades in Sydney as he sets off on the path to notoriety.

results.title: Women 88
results.brief_description: Women ‘88 is a series of seven five minute films. The series was produced for the Women’s Program Bicentennial Authority and celebrates and promotes the past and present quality of Australian Women’s achievement, so as to inspire pride in, and respect for, their diverse contributions to the evolution of Australian society.

results.title: Assault on the Land
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rob Gell’s environment series”.
Examines the problems of salinity, showing how it affects not only the farmers, but all of us. Several methods currently in use to combat the problems are examined in areas of Victoria.

results.title: Sounds Like Australia
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted film that brings you the unique sounds of the Australian bush. It interweaves the songs of our rare birds - The Victorian Rifle, Lyrebird and the Emu among others, with music that celebrates the Australian landscape and its wildlife…the sounds of Australia.

results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.
results.description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Revcom Television, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness, his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Cast includes: Damien Walters - Captain Johnno Rebecca Sykes - Julie Michelle Fawdon - Kathleen Joe Petruzzi - Tony Written by Rob George, music by Stephen Matters. Rated G.
